dialogues.text: Welcome to your first day in office, Mayor PLAYER_NAME. The city is happy to have you as its leader. I’m Jermaine, your Deputy Mayor.
Thank you, Jermaine. I can’t wait to start working together.
I’m happy you’re excited. We’ll need that enthusiasm to help get the city fixed up.
Oh no. The storm was really bad.

choices.selection: We need to get the city fixed up.
choices.response: That’s right! We have to get things in tip-top shape. Join me in the office, and we can get started.

choices.selection: We need to help our citizens.
choices.response: That’s right! We have to get things in tip-top shape. Join me in the office, and we can get started.

dialogues.text: Welcome to our office, Mayor PLAYER_NAME. This is the hub for all things Saltpoint City.
This is so nice.

First, let’s check out the dashboard. If you click on the computer, you can see stats about the city and its citizens. Right now, our citizens’ happiness is very low because of all the damage from the storm.

choices.selection: How can we help improve citizens' happiness?
choices.response: We can start by addressing citizen's issues with the city.

choices.selection: How can we help improve the city?
choices.response: We need to fix the damaged facilities around the city.

dialogues.text: Managing the city’s resources is a big part of our job. Storms are quite frequent here on the coast, so we need to make sure the city can handle any impending storms.
That sounds like a big task.
It is. But we’ll take step by step. How about you start with the beach? The beach was closed due to the storm. It needs to be cleaned before it can be reopened.

choices.selection: That sounds like a great idea. Let's go!
I’ll meet you at the beach. I’d like to explore the city first.

dialogues.text: Good morning, Judith.
Good morning, Jermaine.
This is our new mayor.
Good morning. I’m Mayor PLAYER_NAME.
It’s nice to meet you, mayor. Thanks for coming down to help today.
Judith works closely with our community here in Saltpoint City.
Yes. I’m a community activist, and I’ll be leading the beach clean-up today.

choices.selection: Oh. What’s a community activist?
choices.response: A community activist is someone who lives and works in their community. Our job is to help organize events and speak for others so our community remains safe and happy.

choices.selection: That’s really cool. What’s your job like?
choices.response: I work with people every day to put on events and speak up for others so our community remains safe and happy.

dialogues.text: I’m happy you’ve joined us today. Have you ever done a beach clean-up before?

choices.selection: Yes.
choices.response: That's great! Then you'll be a great addition to our little team.

choices.selection: No.
choices.response: Then I'm happy to help with your first one! At a beach clean-up, volunteers come together to pick up and sort trash.

dialogues.text: Right now, the beach is closed to ensure everyone is safe. This protects beachgoers from possible germs that the trash may have. So, make sure you wear your gloves when helping to clean up.

choices.selection: This means the beach stays clean for all our citizens.
choices.response: Yes, but also for visitors and marine life. Visitors to the beach also help to improve the city’s economy. Clean beaches also create a healthy environment for marine life.

choices.selection: Pretty beaches are better than dirty ones.
choices.response: Yes. Clean beaches encourage more visitors, which can improve our city’s economy. Clean beaches also create a healthy environment for marine life.

choices.selection: Clean beaches help animals
choices.response: Yes. Clean beaches create a healthy environment for marine life. Clean beaches also encourage visitors and citizens to visit the beach, which helps to improve the economy.

dialogues.text: Do you know how a clean beach helps marine animals?

choices.selection: A clean beach means people won't hurt animals.
choices.response: That’s true! A clean beach means that animals on the beach won’t get caught in the trash. But most marine animals live in the ocean.

choices.selection: A clean beach means there’s less trash in the ocean.
choices.response: That’s correct! A clean beach means that less trash will go from the beach and into the ocean.

choices.selection: A clean beach means more tourists will come.
choices.response: That’s true. But more tourists may also mean more trash.

dialogues.text: Trash from the beach can go into the ocean and harm animals there. Animals can become trapped in the trash and get hurt. Some marine animals, like turtles, are born on the beach, and they can get trapped in trash while trying to get to the ocean.
That’s right! We need to keep the beach clean for the turtles.
Are you ready to start?

choices.selection: Yes.
No.
choices.response: When you’re ready to start, click on any beach tile to come see me.

dialogues.text: Whew! That was hard work. Thank you so much for your help, mayor.
I was happy to help!
It's good to have a mayor who works so closely wth the community. If you have any questions for me, feel free to reach out.
